In December 6th of 2012, BYU-Idaho President Kim B. Clark and Vice President Henry J. Eyring discussed Pathway, a BYU-Idaho program through which several thousands are being blessed world-wide. They discussed key points such as the purpose of Pathway, Speaking Partners, and how the Priesthood leaders are part of this amazing program. President Clark in speaking about the three objectives of the Pathway Program said:

 "Pathway has three objectives. First is faith. We want to help our students in Pathway get the Gospel deep in their hearts, to truly become converted. The second is learning. We want to help our students become capable, lifelong Gospel learners who know how to learn, especially by the Spirit. And the third objective is to prepare students to live providently and lead their families."
-President Kim B. Clark, President of BYU-Idaho

The way we measure success in the Pathway Program is through the improvement and success that individuals make to these objectives. The university has a mission to extend this opportunity to many people. In 1972, Elder Bednar, then President to BYU-Idaho spoke during his inaugural address and said:

"Ricks College (BYU-Idaho) we would not only teach the thousands of students who come here to Rexburg, but we would eventually teach tens of thousands of students all over the world."
-Elder David A. Bednar, then President of Ricks College (BYU-Idaho)

Below are a few featured questions

Q - I'm a BYU-I Ambassador. How can I help my bishop or stake How should I approach them to educate them on Pathway?

A - First, prepare by digesting the information on our website. Best advice - understand the program, but present it as a natural fit for the efforts they are already making to reach out a hand of rescue to young adults. This is much more than an academic program - this is about saving souls. The blessing that come to individuals and families are powerful evidence of the Lord's love for His children. As leaders who hold keys embrace opportunities like Pathway with the intent to bring blessings to their members, miracles occur.

Q - How can I express to my students the importance of this program and motivate them to succeed in their goals?

A - Share your testimony of the program itself and the value of an education. Let them know that you have confidence in their ability to succeed, and continually encourage them to work hard, pray for help, and reach out to campus support resources when necessary.

Q - Can you remind us who do priesthood leaders need to contact to propose a site for Pathway?

A - Priesthood leaders should express their interest up through their Area Seventy so that strategic direction can be provided. Then a designated leader should contact BYU-Idaho by sending an email to onlinelearning@byui.edu or by calling 1-866-672-2984.
